Key Findings: 54% on treatment, 42% controlled BP. ACE inhibitor most common.
ML-guided prescribing achieved avg. 14.2 mmHg SBP reduction; deprescibing benefit

Secondary Outcomes: Medicine use by age, race, region
Key Findings: 1-in-5 treated adults uncontrolled; disparities by race and region
Thiazide and ACEi most effective for BP reduction; ARB best tolerance
